channel.title: Spiritual Eyes Ministry Devotional Podcast
channel.description: A podcast focusing on serving the Lord and glorifying Him through scripture-based devotionals.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Come Join Me in a Devotional!
channel.itunes:author: KeAndri ( Talley
channel.itunes:summary: A podcast focusing on serving the Lord and glorifying Him through scripture-based devotionals.

item.title: Hearing God's Voice
item.description: Have you ever wondered if God can be heard? Are you going through a situation where you’re seeking to find out if the little voice you’ve been hearing is that of God, your flesh, or the voice of Satan? God does speak to us and we can hear His voice. But, we must be cautious that what we hear is indeed God's voice. Join me as we explore passages in the books of John, I John, II Timothy, Hebrews, I Thessalonians, Proverbs, Colossians, and Psalms to help us in how we determine the true and profound voice of God.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever wondered if God can be heard? Are you going through a situation where you’re seeking to find out if the little voice you’ve been hearing is that of God, your flesh, or the voice of Satan? God does speak to us and we can hear His voice. But, we must be cautious that what we hear is indeed God's voice. Join me as we explore passages in the books of John, I John, II Timothy, Hebrews, I Thessalonians, Proverbs, Colossians, and Psalms to help us in how we determine the true and profound voice of God.

item.title: Trust In The Lord
item.description: As humans, we are quick to place our trust in others rather than looking to our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ for the trust we so desperately need. Friends will come and go...family will support and oppose. But, the Lord will neither abandon us nor forsake us...and it is with Him we should place our trust. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Proverbs, Psalm, and Isaiah to help us understand the importance of trusting in the Lord.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: As humans, we are quick to place our trust in others rather than looking to our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ for the trust we so desperately need. Friends will come and go...family will support and oppose. But, the Lord will neither abandon us nor forsake us...and it is with Him we should place our trust. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Proverbs, Psalm, and Isaiah to help us understand the importance of trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Unanswered Prayers
item.description: Are your prayers being answered? Sometimes, we pray and wait for God to answer our prayers. And, sometimes, these prayers go unanswered. Are you asking for the right things? Are you asking with a genuine heart? Join me as we explore passages in the books of Matthew and Mark that touch on prayer and God's willingness and ability to answer our prayers through our faith in Him.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Are your prayers being answered? Sometimes, we pray and wait for God to answer our prayers. And, sometimes, these prayers go unanswered. Are you asking for the right things? Are you asking with a genuine heart? Join me as we explore passages in the books of Matthew and Mark that touch on prayer and God's willingness and ability to answer our prayers through our faith in Him.

item.title: Greatness In Service
item.description: There is much greatness in serving God and those who do good by it...the Lord will reward abundantly!!! Join me as we explore passages in the books of Matthew, Ephesians, and First John to help us point out the proper and improper ways to serve God. To God Be The Glory!!!!
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: There is much greatness in serving God and those who do good by it...the Lord will reward abundantly!!! Join me as we explore passages in the books of Matthew, Ephesians, and First John to help us point out the proper and improper ways to serve God. To God Be The Glory!!!!

item.title: Young Lambs
item.description: Children cannot raise themselves...many are like young lambs who need guidance from their shepherds. We, as parents, are their shepherds and it is up to us to nurture and guide them in the right way...as God sees fit. Join me as we explore passages, in books of Psalm and Deuteronomy, that touch on the significance of being shepherds to our children.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Children cannot raise themselves...many are like young lambs who need guidance from their shepherds. We, as parents, are their shepherds and it is up to us to nurture and guide them in the right way...as God sees fit. Join me as we explore passages, in books of Psalm and Deuteronomy, that touch on the significance of being shepherds to our children.

item.title: Unfailing Love
item.description: Most things in life have a possibility of failing; however, there is only one thing that prevails and never fails---and that is God's unfailing love. God loves us despite our shortcomings. He loves us when we stay ever so closely to Him. He even loves us when we're rebellious. Join me as we explore a passage in First Corinthians that touches on God's unfailing love (charity)and how it never fails and endures all things.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Most things in life have a possibility of failing; however, there is only one thing that prevails and never fails---and that is God's unfailing love. God loves us despite our shortcomings. He loves us when we stay ever so closely to Him. He even loves us when we're rebellious. Join me as we explore a passage in First Corinthians that touches on God's unfailing love (charity)and how it never fails and endures all things.

item.title: Sunflowers
item.description: As parents, we want the best for our children and, at the same time, we want our children to be the best they can be in life. Every good parent wants a wise child. And, with that wise child, comes obedience and knowledge. Join me as we explore several passages in the book of Proverbs concerning children and the importance of wisdom.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: As parents, we want the best for our children and, at the same time, we want our children to be the best they can be in life. Every good parent wants a wise child. And, with that wise child, comes obedience and knowledge. Join me as we explore several passages in the book of Proverbs concerning children and the importance of wisdom.

item.title: Fleeting Charm
item.description: Charm is deceptive and beauty is fleeting! The Bible tells us that we need to take a different approach to appearance than fitting into society’s idea of beauty. God doesn't focus on our outward appearance. It is what's our inside that matters most to Him. The Bible tells us that God's focus is on developing our inner beauty so that it can be reflected in everything we do and who we are. Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Proverbs dealing with fleeting charm!
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Charm is deceptive and beauty is fleeting! The Bible tells us that we need to take a different approach to appearance than fitting into society’s idea of beauty. God doesn't focus on our outward appearance. It is what's our inside that matters most to Him. The Bible tells us that God's focus is on developing our inner beauty so that it can be reflected in everything we do and who we are. Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Proverbs dealing with fleeting charm!

item.title: Lying Lips
item.description: Truthfulness is a great virtue to possess, but it’s hard to maintain. Sometimes it seems easier and less cruel to go with a little lie, although it’s never a wise move and will eventually cause more trouble than it’s worth. A lying tongue, lying lips, or telling lies is an abomination to God. Join me as we explore passages in the book of Proverbs that show us just how detestable and despised lying lips are to God.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Truthfulness is a great virtue to possess, but it’s hard to maintain. Sometimes it seems easier and less cruel to go with a little lie, although it’s never a wise move and will eventually cause more trouble than it’s worth. A lying tongue, lying lips, or telling lies is an abomination to God. Join me as we explore passages in the book of Proverbs that show us just how detestable and despised lying lips are to God.

item.title: Money Never Satisfies
item.description: Money! Many people would love to have it and many people strive to get it. It consumes them and becomes the center of their lives. But, money never satisfies...it is the root of all evil, when we allow it to consume us. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Ecclesiastes, Psalms, First Timothy, Romans, and Hebrews to aid us in understanding why and how money is meaningless and to reveal the truth about money.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Money! Many people would love to have it and many people strive to get it. It consumes them and becomes the center of their lives. But, money never satisfies...it is the root of all evil, when we allow it to consume us. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Ecclesiastes, Psalms, First Timothy, Romans, and Hebrews to aid us in understanding why and how money is meaningless and to reveal the truth about money.

item.title: Nobodies
item.description: We must humble ourselves before the Lord. Submitting to God involves trusting in Him, and when we trust in Him we will not be disappointed; He will exalt us, lift us up, and establish us in due time. Join me as we explore passages in First Peter, Deuteronomy, and Proverbs to help us understand the importance of being humble and meek in the eyes of God.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: We must humble ourselves before the Lord. Submitting to God involves trusting in Him, and when we trust in Him we will not be disappointed; He will exalt us, lift us up, and establish us in due time. Join me as we explore passages in First Peter, Deuteronomy, and Proverbs to help us understand the importance of being humble and meek in the eyes of God.

item.title: Brotherly Love
item.description: We are to love one another as God love us...for God is love! Join me as we explore passages in the books of First John and First Corinthians...as God points out the importance of loving others.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: We are to love one another as God love us...for God is love! Join me as we explore passages in the books of First John and First Corinthians...as God points out the importance of loving others.

item.title: Riotous Children
item.description: Our children are our future. Our future depends on their success, goals, determination, and responsibility. In order for our children to acquire these qualities, as parents, we must train them up in the way they should go. We must be positive role models in their lives and we should nurture them with the knowledge and love of God. Join me as we explore a couple of passages in the book of Proverbs---the book of instruction and wisdom...on parenting and children.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Our children are our future. Our future depends on their success, goals, determination, and responsibility. In order for our children to acquire these qualities, as parents, we must train them up in the way they should go. We must be positive role models in their lives and we should nurture them with the knowledge and love of God. Join me as we explore a couple of passages in the book of Proverbs---the book of instruction and wisdom...on parenting and children.

item.title: A True Friend Indeed
item.description: Sometimes, we go through difficult times with friends. Sometimes, we may feel like we have no friends at all. But, we must realize that we always have a friend in Jesus. He is a true friend indeed! Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Proverbs and discover what a friend is, according to God.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes, we go through difficult times with friends. Sometimes, we may feel like we have no friends at all. But, we must realize that we always have a friend in Jesus. He is a true friend indeed! Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Proverbs and discover what a friend is, according to God.

item.title: Get Over It
item.description: We have not forgiven someone, if we tend to go back and relive the wrongdoing in our minds, or we end up holding a grudge. Our God is a forgiving God, and we should want to be forgiving people. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Leviticus, Colossians, and First Peter that explain how we are to forgive and get over whatever it is that has troubled us.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: We have not forgiven someone, if we tend to go back and relive the wrongdoing in our minds, or we end up holding a grudge. Our God is a forgiving God, and we should want to be forgiving people. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Leviticus, Colossians, and First Peter that explain how we are to forgive and get over whatever it is that has troubled us.

item.title: Healing Love
item.description: Sometimes, we get so busy in our everyday lives that we forget all about our Almighty God who is the very reason we are still here on Earth...alive and breathing. We allow worldly things to cloud our minds and distract us...taking our eyes off the prize. When we suddenly become separated from God, in some way, He still keeps loving us as if we never were separated from Him. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Hosea and Isaiah that tell us about God's healing love.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes, we get so busy in our everyday lives that we forget all about our Almighty God who is the very reason we are still here on Earth...alive and breathing. We allow worldly things to cloud our minds and distract us...taking our eyes off the prize. When we suddenly become separated from God, in some way, He still keeps loving us as if we never were separated from Him. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Hosea and Isaiah that tell us about God's healing love.

item.title: Due Benevolence
item.description: Sometimes, in marriage, husbands and wives forget what their duties are to one another. A disposition to do good, an act of kindness, or a generous gift----all due benevolence, and so much more, are required to seal a marriage and keep it strong. Join me as we explore passages in First Corinthians, Genesis, and Ephesians to help us learn exactly what elements God says are essential to keep a marriage thriving.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes, in marriage, husbands and wives forget what their duties are to one another. A disposition to do good, an act of kindness, or a generous gift----all due benevolence, and so much more, are required to seal a marriage and keep it strong. Join me as we explore passages in First Corinthians, Genesis, and Ephesians to help us learn exactly what elements God says are essential to keep a marriage thriving.

item.title: Eternally Useful
item.description: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness. The Bible is eternally useful to us. It is our sure guide to eternal life. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Second Timothy and Acts to show us how eternally useful the Bible is in keeping us faithfully grounded and seeking God’s salvation.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness. The Bible is eternally useful to us. It is our sure guide to eternal life. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Second Timothy and Acts to show us how eternally useful the Bible is in keeping us faithfully grounded and seeking God’s salvation.

item.title: Powerlessness
item.description: Have you let the state of feeling powerless get the best of you? Have you ever felt like everything was out of your control…your life, finances, people?, etc. Those of you who have experienced this feeling know just how weak and vulnerable you may seem during these times. But, if we would just turn to God for our source of strength, there would be no need to ever feel powerless, weak, or vulnerable. We are NEVER powerless with the Lord on our side! Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Isaiah to help us understand where we should get our source of strength from.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Have you let the state of feeling powerless get the best of you? Have you ever felt like everything was out of your control…your life, finances, people?, etc. Those of you who have experienced this feeling know just how weak and vulnerable you may seem during these times. But, if we would just turn to God for our source of strength, there would be no need to ever feel powerless, weak, or vulnerable. We are NEVER powerless with the Lord on our side! Join me as we explore a passage in the book of Isaiah to help us understand where we should get our source of strength from.

item.title: Uncommon Courtesy
item.description: There are many places in the Bible that explain to couples the type of love and respect they should show each other. The best example of chivalry in the Bible is Jesus, who not only treated everyone He met with respect, but also put our needs above His own to be our Lord and Savior. Good character alone makes any man worthy of love. Simple acts of chivalry and courtesy shows respect. Men who practice this respectful behavior are much more engaging and appealing as potential mates. Old-fashioned etiquette will go a long way when winning over the heart of a lady. Join me as we explore a passage in Ephesians to enlighten us about uncommon courtesy----chivalry.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: There are many places in the Bible that explain to couples the type of love and respect they should show each other. The best example of chivalry in the Bible is Jesus, who not only treated everyone He met with respect, but also put our needs above His own to be our Lord and Savior. Good character alone makes any man worthy of love. Simple acts of chivalry and courtesy shows respect. Men who practice this respectful behavior are much more engaging and appealing as potential mates. Old-fashioned etiquette will go a long way when winning over the heart of a lady. Join me as we explore a passage in Ephesians to enlighten us about uncommon courtesy----chivalry.

item.title: Love Covers Sins
item.description: Love covers sins! It fuels relationships in a good way.. When we forgive, we don't keep score of offenses against us. Some people have vivid memories of past sins of others, but a vague memory for remembering their own sins. When Jesus died on the cross for our sins, he cried out, "It is finished!" When you say you forgive, remember Jesus' words on the cross. Let that be the end of it. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Proverbs, First Peter, and James in helping us learn how love covers sins.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Love covers sins! It fuels relationships in a good way.. When we forgive, we don't keep score of offenses against us. Some people have vivid memories of past sins of others, but a vague memory for remembering their own sins. When Jesus died on the cross for our sins, he cried out, "It is finished!" When you say you forgive, remember Jesus' words on the cross. Let that be the end of it. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Proverbs, First Peter, and James in helping us learn how love covers sins.

item.title: The Act of Forgiveness
item.description: Forgiveness can be thought of in many ways. It can be thought of in terms of the person who forgives, in terms of the person forgiven and/or in terms of the relationship between the forgiver and the person forgiven. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Mark, James, and Luke to help us learn what forgiveness really means.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Forgiveness can be thought of in many ways. It can be thought of in terms of the person who forgives, in terms of the person forgiven and/or in terms of the relationship between the forgiver and the person forgiven. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Mark, James, and Luke to help us learn what forgiveness really means.

item.title: Love's Value
item.description: Love is from God…God is love. Love is one of the primary characteristics of God. Likewise, God has endowed us with the capacity for love. This capacity for love is one of the ways in which we are "created in the image of God." Join me as we examine a scripture verse in the book of Song of Solomon to search out the true meaning of the value of “love”.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Love is from God…God is love. Love is one of the primary characteristics of God. Likewise, God has endowed us with the capacity for love. This capacity for love is one of the ways in which we are "created in the image of God." Join me as we examine a scripture verse in the book of Song of Solomon to search out the true meaning of the value of “love”.

item.title: The Redemption of Jesus
item.description: Let us not forget the redemption of Jesus. God wanted that human salvation would be by grace, but also that there would be a ransom. The ransom was paid as the price for the sins of the world. This price was the blood and death of the Son of God, Jesus Christ. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Ephesians, First Peter, and Galatians to help explain how we were redeemed by our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Let us not forget the redemption of Jesus. God wanted that human salvation would be by grace, but also that there would be a ransom. The ransom was paid as the price for the sins of the world. This price was the blood and death of the Son of God, Jesus Christ. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Ephesians, First Peter, and Galatians to help explain how we were redeemed by our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Faith in Jesus
item.description: As humans, we tend to put our faith more in mankind than in Jesus. Faith is looking to Jesus! Join me as we seek to find the importance of putting our faith in Jesus…examining passages in the books of Luke and Hebrews.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: As humans, we tend to put our faith more in mankind than in Jesus. Faith is looking to Jesus! Join me as we seek to find the importance of putting our faith in Jesus…examining passages in the books of Luke and Hebrews.

item.title: Take Refuge
item.description: It is inevitable...we will face a trial or tribulation at some point in our lives. But, if we take refuge in God during this time, he will see us through 'til the end. Join me as we explore passages in the books of Psalm, Hebrews, and First Peter to help us understand why it is so important to seek safety in God. My Podcast Alley feed! {pca-bd2ec23fa27eda15042a83e057e66268}

item.title: Possibilities - I Have a Testimony
item.description: Possibilities are things that may certainly exist or occur given the proper conditions. Join me as I share a devotional centered around the scripture verse, Mark 9:23, and how it relates to a recent testimonial in my life.
item.dc:creator: KeAndri ( Talley
item.itunes:summary: Possibilities are things that may certainly exist or occur given the proper conditions. Join me as I share a devotional centered around the scripture verse, Mark 9:23, and how it relates to a recent testimonial in my life.

item.description: Introduction Podcast: Welcome to the Spiritual Eyes Ministry's first ever devotional podcast!
